result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Snow states that he has received a lot of information from a third party that he needs to get to the district attorney and requests another hearing. Court sets for Status Hearing on November 22, 2022 at 1:00 PM
Status hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:07 PM Defendant THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI. Atty Snow states he is still investigating. 

Motion to Modify Bond on 22CF58 - Statement by Atty Snow regarding reasons for modification of bond to something more reasonable. Statement by DA Lapisa, opposes the request and states a victim is present. Statement by AP. Further statement by DA Laspisa, requests both bonds say No Contact as one says No Contact and the other says No Violent Contact. Statement by the Court. Court denies the motion to modify bond. Court makes statement to Atty Snow re: recusal. Further statement by Atty Snow, is requesting modification to allow a phone call to the children. Statement by the Court. Further statement by DA Laspisa.

Court adjourned at 2:16 PM

Court sets for Status Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 1:15 PM
Pre-Trial Status Report
Motion hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Todd Snow dated 07/11/2022 re: request matter be rescheduled due to jury duty in Dodge County
Motion hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
for Amendment of Bond Conditions - Defendant's
Return date on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:01 PM Defendant THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq appeared by video for THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI. Court calls both cases 2022CF29 & 2022CF58. Atty Snow states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing in both cases. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination on each case. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files the informations with the court, same as the criminal complaints and emailed to Atty Snow. Attorney Snow waives reading. Atty Snow enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant on each case. Court will set for Return Date on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

2022CF29 - Motion to Modify Bond. Atty Snow states the defendant is not agreeing to the modification. Statement by DA Laspisa regarding bond  Statement by Atty Snow regarding bond condition. Court denies the motion for bond modification.

Court adjourned at 1:09 P.M.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely (for atty Snow)
Letter to Judge Slate dated May 03, 2022 re: zoom request
Waiver of Prelim on May 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

I called Atty Snow's office to reschedule the Waiver of Prelim per Atty Snow's request. Atty Snow's Tuesdays are completely booked through mid-June. Waiver of Prelim was rescheduled to Monday May 9, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
Letter to Judge Slate dated April 22, 2022 re: adjournment request
Waiver of Prelim on May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:06 PM Defendant THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq appeared by video for THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI. Atty Snow states he will be waiving the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Atty Snow states defendant will likely be waiving the preliminary hearing. Statement by DA Laspisa. Court sets waiver of prelim for May 10, 2022 at 11:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:07 AM.

No Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

No Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.

1:03 PM Defendant THOMAS A PIECHOWSKI appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for the defendant. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $5,000 cash bond and conditions of: No Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on April 11, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 1:09 PM
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
